speaker: B
text: So, Nico, FTX has been in the news a lot, especially with its impacts on crypto and everything like that. Is there any more contagion risk involved in that?

speaker: A
text: Well, Nick, unfortunately, it is hard to say if there is more contagion risk out there or if there isn't. It's especially difficult because sometimes people will make these type of claims months in advance before they go down, but it's hard to separate the signal from the noise in all of those situations. But there are steps that individuals can take to protect themselves from that type of contagion risk.

speaker: B
text: Okay, so it's anybody's guess, really.

speaker: A
text: Yeah, unfortunately, it's anybody's guess. As we see, these have long tailwinds, as we saw in 2022, starting with Luna in May and ending with FTX, obviously in November. But individuals can be proactive in taking their money off of exchanges ahead of time. So then in case there is contagion risk, they're not left dealing with an exchange that is going bankrupt and losing all their coins.

speaker: B
text: All right, interesting. Should we keep on our toes, then?

speaker: A
text: In crypto, you always got to keep on your toes. It's the name of the game in such a fast moving and new space. So just be ready to react quickly and make sure you take precautionary measures, like getting that money off the exchange and onto your wallet.

speaker: B
